snippet: The State Department of Transportation will install new concrete barriers on three viaducts along the Bronx River Parkway, following a fatal accident on Sunday.
abstract: New York State Transportation Dept plans to install concrete barriers on three viaducts along the Bronx River Parkway, following an accident that claimed the lives of seven relatives when their car hit a guardrail and then plunged 60 feet from overpass. Photo (M)l
lead_paragraph: The State Transportation Department will immediately begin installing new concrete barriers on three viaducts along the Bronx River Parkway, following a catastrophic accident that claimed the lives of seven relatives last weekend, officials said Wednesday. The barriers will be placed along the traffic lane farthest to the right, adding a protective measure to supplement the existing guardrails, transportation officials said.

headline.main: New Barriers Planned on Road Where 7 Died
